author: Staff Reporter
text:
The Principal Sessions Court here on Friday summoned DMK treasurer M.K Stalin, DMDK leader Vijayakant, and PMK leader Anbumani Ramadoss to appear before it in connection with defamation charges pressed against them by the State government for allegedly making baseless statements on the recent flooding in Chennai and its surrounding districts.

The Principal Session Judge P.Rajamanickam ordered issuance of summons on various criminal defamation charges moved by Chief Minister Jayalalithaa and Revenue Minister R.B. Udhaya Kumar against the political leaders. Mr. Stalin had been asked to appear on April 18, Mr. Ramadoss on April 21 and Vijayakant on April 25.

Similarly, the editor, publisher and a journalist of the Economic Times had been directed to appear in court on April 6, for allegedly publishing defamatory news reports about the flood. The court also directed the editor, printer and publisher of Dinakaran to appear that day. The editor, printer and publisher of the DMK mouthpiece Murasoli was directed to appear on April 12.
title: Court summons Stalin, Vijayakant
